column5: There's not even time to burn the bodies anymore
Just take them outside of the city...
*A foot in each world and his soul in the middle,$Nthe dying man sees all things.
What are you doing? Are you crazy?
He offers so much more... to be a part of something... greater.
ALL WILL JOIN. ALL BECOME VESSELS.
Beats me. Five minutes ago you were just a dead body and I was just a guy trying to loot some new shoes.
So good news! You're alive, and don't seem to have the plague anymore.
The bad news is, this means I don't get a new pair of shoes.
Also, now you're trapped in this plague colony with the rest of us.
Cheer up! You survived, so you should be immune to the plague now.
So then the guards will let us out, right?
You could try explaining that to them, but they aren't that good at listening.
*They tend to confuse answering politely" with
Seriously. I don't know what kind of etiquette training the Ash Kingdom hands out these days.
I still don't understand what happened in that... other place...
Don't sweat it. I had the same hallucination when I first had the plague.
Wait - you were there with me! How could it have been a hallucination?
At least tell me your name!
Yo, caravan guys! Anybody got any shoes?
We need to get out of here, right now.
We aren't immune to getting our faces eaten when they turn.
Those people... they turned into monsters!
You must be new around here.
That's what happens to people who don't survive the plague.
We were just in the same place as before... that half-way place...
This pit is terrible! We have to get out of here!
Please, people have been trying to escape for ten years.
This has been going on for ten years?!
Let me guess, you're from the capital, aren't you?
Figures.  The Lord Regent keeps a pretty tight lid on things.
I bet you don't even know the war is over.
The war is over?! But the soldiers... the... where are all the troops being sent to?
Hello? Plague that turns people into monsters? Takes a hell of a lot of containment!
Hey, look on the bright side - at least the Revenant are gone.
Wait, they're not just gone, they're DEAD!
No one's ever done that before!
Revenant are invincible... or at least they used to be!
Oh, man, is this ever my lucky day!
I've got a new BEST friend with secret magical powers...
AND an unguarded caravan brimming with riches! We're rich! Rich, I tell you!
I am Ozimal Kaz, warlord of the Pit, and this tribute belongs to me.
Look, I just got here, I've got no idea-
Guards, throw these worthless thieves in the Coliseum!
Show them what happens to those who steal from Ozimal Kaz.
I take it this is your first execution?
Yep. In a second they're going to open those gates and hordes of monsters are going to come in and eat us.
I don't know about you, princess, but I intend to go down swinging.
*Wait! If we're going to die, we should at least know each other's names. I'm $MCG.
Impossible. Nobody's ever killed a Revenant.
It's that new girl... I don't know what she did, but the prisoners are alive and the Revenant are all dead.
Then, send a letter to our friend, the collector.
Tell him I have an interesting new item for sale.
I felt like... my heart was being pulled in two directions at once.
Sorry, but I don't really know. All I know is it works.
We're alive, though! That's gotta count for something, right?
Alive and going insane, apparently. Ye gods, I need a drink.
How do you know my name?
The guard will be back soon. You need to listen if you want to make it out of here alive.
Listen carefully: tomorrow Ozimal is going to try to sell you to a man in red. I can't let that happen.
He will send you to the Coliseum again to demonstrate your skills.
When this happens, I will cause a distraction. You must make your escape at that moment.
Take this scrap. Use it to bribe whatever help you can from your fellow prisoners. You must be ready for tomorrow.
For now, it's safer if you don't know. Find me at the Monastery. I will explain everything there.
*$MCG, you must not fall into his hands.
So, my honored guest, how are things in the outside world?
The plague has destroyed the Quaid Empire entirely. Nothing remains but the twisted inhuman hordes of the infected.
Well, that's something to rejoice at.
Now it spreads into the Ash Kingdom. If nothing is done, this disease will accomplish what the Quaidian war could not.
Well, as long as panicked Ashani keep exiling the infected here, we lords of the Pit will stay in business.
The plague's monstrosities are quite valuable to the man who knows how to use them, eh?
Enough of this small talk. Where is this girl?
Over there. I think you will be interested in her abilities.
She enters a trance, and her companions seem to fade into nothingness.
All around them the Revenant fall dead in heaps, as if slain by invisible blows.
Incredible. She sees them for what they really are.
She fights them in their own world.
*Consider the payment doubled.$NIt is not often I meet an equal.
Sir, the south wall of the coliseum has collapsed!
Release our Revenant! Hunt them down!
It's no use, they're gaining on us!
Quick, across the river! We'll hold them off at the ford!
There are too many of them!
*$BER! I think you're on to something!
*I spit upon the eyes of the traitor, the murderer of honor.$NMay he drown in his own blood.$NMay his carcass rot in the earth.$NMay frost eternal take his bones.
I'll tear your faces off and use your skulls to hold DECORATIVE HOUSEPLANTS!
Well, that mysterious old man said to find him at “the Monastery”...
Ah, he must mean the Selini Chapter House on the north side of the Pit.
There are Ash Temple Monks here in this... plague colony?
What better place for a hospital? Come on, I'll show you the way.
Well, he's crazy as hell, sure, but he seems to be loyal. I can't afford to be picky when it comes to friends.
No, I don't mean the clown, I mean that mysterious old man.
If he's an Ash Temple Monk, we have nothing to worry about.
You think your church has never gotten its hands dirty?
You don't have to come if you don't trust him.
And give up my chance of escaping with you? I'd take on the whole Ash Kingdom if it meant getting out of this hellhole.
*Listen, $MCG, if we're going to make it to the Monastery, I think we're going to need more people.
People that you can rely on in a fight.
What, and cover up this glorious physique?
What? I'm all we need! I have the body of a bronze god!
...and the brains of a drunken weasel.
She's worth a fortune! I want her alive.
What, the whole town dead and not one prisoner captured?!
Sir, we don't have enough Revenant to continue.
You think I don't know that? Get out of my sight!
You cannot allow them to escape.
What can I do? My Revenant are decimated.
We don't have enough troops to continue.
Look around you. What do you see?
I see dozens of corpses, not one of which belongs to our prey!
We have all the reinforcements that we need.
Hold on, there's some people on the road.
Others must have escaped from the village!
Everyone there should have been immune to the plague.  All the survivors have already had it.
I don't think they turned on their own.
I Call the Big One Blinky
Aw man, and all I need is three more Revenant skulls to finish my necklace!
I call the big one Blinky, and the little one here Mr. Teeth.
*$MCG, there's a small caravan of nomads here that have offered us supplies - for the right price of course.
Turns out the Headsman is my grandfather's fifth wife's second cousin, so I was able to haggle us some pretty good discounts.
I recommend that we stock up while we can.
*Hey there stranger! You name doesn't happen to be $MCG, does it?
A couple days ago, this old man stopped by.
He said you would follow, and asked me to give you this thingamajig.
He said it would help you on your way.
He was a teensy bit weird, if you ask me.
But anybody handing out free pieces of paper is ok in my book!
I can't get enough of the stuff.
Here we are: the Chapter House of the 7th Branch of Seleni!
What, you were expecting something else?
I just thought it would look more like the Royal Temples back in Ash.
Well, I can chant if that would make it feel more temple-y.
It just looks more like a fortress than a temple.
Indeed, for there are many dangers in the Pit.
You think that old fool sitting behind his walls can save you?
You are cut off.  That Monastery might as well be in the furthest reaches of the Quaid Empire for all the good it will do you.
The gate is open!  Quick, before they can regroup!
Once again we owe you our lives, honorable elder.
I act for myself as much as for others.
You do not know your own importance.
One who can travel into their world...
Please, if you can explain any of the events of the last week to me -
There is much to say and little time to say it.
The enemy army still sits at our gates.
At least tell me this: to whom do I owe my life?
And I'm not about to send my men to storm that Monastery wall.
That's exactly what you are going to do.
No, my friend, we are done.  A pox on you!  This deal of yours has cost me a fortune.
It will cost you a little more yet.
My children, I have a task for you...
The last of their force is broken.
We are free for the moment.
That's him. He speaks through the dying Revenant.
You see now that I cannot be stopped.
Hand over the girl, and this Temple house may be spared.
Zelemir, the man you once were-
What can YOU tell me of being a “Man,” you who watch the world end behind monk's robes and monastery walls!
You would keep your hands clean in this sea of blood?
I do not have the luxury of your morality, my friend.  I will do whatever it takes to save our world.
This? This is salvation? The death of millions? This sea of blood is your own creation!
The death of some may save the whole. A sacrifice you made yourself, as I remember...
*Enough. I speak now to the one called $MCG.
You can save countless lives by surrendering now.
You are too dangerous to live.
Come with me and you will save thousands, perhaps even millions, of lives.
The Order will never betray one who has entered its walls.
*The gear does not resent the lever, nor the weight the chain, but each part works in harmony to fulfill the design of its Creator.
*$N$N$N$N$N-from the second letter of Selinadt to the Seven Kingdoms
I'm still having a hard time believing that corpses can do this...
The bodies are merely vessels for the spirit that inhabits them.
The other world you travel to, the world of spirit, allows you to strike at the essence, rather than just the physical host.
...Yes.  Through unknown power he fills the bodies of the dead with his own will...
To pursue his own dark goals.
*There are many things I must tell you, $MCG.
...But our time runs short.  I shall continue when we are safely outside these walls.
I must express my gratitude for all that your monks have done for us.  I did not expect anyone to help the plague victims here.
Restoring order to chaos has always been the calling of the Selini.  We are traveling to a hospital we have nearby.
You think that we'll be safe there?
No, but one of the patients could make a very powerful ally.
You are not the only one to return from the brink of death with strange, new abilities.
Elder, is that smoke in the distance?
That is the last of them.
This is the fourth attack in as many days.
The enemies were beaten back like dogs.
Still as bellicose as ever, I see.
I would like you to meet the person responsible for the victory today.
It is a pleasure to meet new allies in this fight.
I am grateful for all this place has given me.
You saved my life when I would have become one of the ...cold ones.
But the walls of this Hospital fence me in.
Though shrouded in ice, the fury of the Cosmic Flame still burns within me.
I long to take the fight to the enemy.
More of them at the gates!
Even in this life of service, I am still the daughter of fire.
The enemy that comes against me will burn!
Ahem.  I mean no offense, but she's Quaid, isn't she?
The vast majority of people down here are.
The Pit was a prisoner of war camp long before the plague.
Many of these people have been working the mines for years, only to have the plague victims dumped in with them.
That doesn't change the fact that they're a bunch of genocidal fire-worshiping lunatics.  The Quaid empire stopped at nothing to-
*$MCG, the Quaid Empire is dead.  The enemy who destroyed it now turns his attention to the rest of the world.
We cannot quibble about the nature of our allies.
*Oh, hey $MAG, I didn't see you there.
We were just discussing um, stuff and things...
That's good. You know what they say:
“Don't gossip about anyone who might slit your throat at night.”
I'm not terribly familiar with that saying...who...um...who says that?
People whose throats haven't been slit, presumably.
'Cause the ones that have don't have all that much to say.
And then you say, “Was that advice? I don't know. Can you speak up?”
Me too! Friends are great! For instance, if you need to slit someone's throat in their sleep, you can say, “Hey friend, hold this person down-”
...I have this really important question for you!
Um... what's with this whole ice thing? I know you're generally more of a fire person, so...
So why am I not shooting fireballs out of my eye sockets?
When I was dying... I saw hell... frozen blackness stretching out into infinity.  A place without warmth or light.
And a golden man, whispering my name.  I knew then that to listen would be damnation.
I tried to flee, but could not move. Each moment the whispers grew louder until they drowned my screams.
Then suddenly it all vanished.  I was here in the hospital, being cared for by the monks.
But though I had escaped hell, I found I had brought a piece of it with me.
This... ice in my heart... I have never felt the same.
Each day I hope the Flame will make me whole again... and each day the curse continues.
I am not the only one who has had this experience. Many survive the plague and return changed.
Until such time as the Flame pities us, we use these curses against those who oppose righteousness.
It just goes to show, if you put your mind to it, you can use anything to kill your enemies.
If we cannot seek asylum here, reverend elder, what is it you plan to do?
*$MCG, I have been guilty of a great many things in my life...
I do not wish to add deceiving you to that list.
If I am to continue guiding you, there are things you must know about me and our opponent.
...Yes. The once great leader of our people, now driven mad with arcane power.
Wait, you mean he's THE Zelemir? As in, Prince Zelemir Ashantimon?
But, he died a hero in the war!
So everyone believes, but the truth is a more bitter history.
Before your time, when the Quaid war reached its height... you cannot imagine the destruction.
We were on the verge of annihilation.
Zelemir and I were generals in the Ash Army, then. We were like brothers.
Our men fought like tigers, but we knew we were doomed.
Each day we saw Ash brought one step closer to destruction.
Then, amidst the ruins of an enemy city, Prince Zelemir made a discovery.
The location of an ancient power, lost in ages long past.
With the enemy at our gates, he formed a plan.
A dark plan, born of desperation.
And I, in my foolishness, helped him.
*$MCG, I have dedicated what remains of my life to undoing Zelemir's destruction as best I can.
For whatever reason, he has chosen YOU as the focus of his madness.
If we can discover why, we may be able to use it against him.
*You have seen what he is capable of, $MCG. Will you help me in this?
Prepare yourselves. We have a long march ahead of us.
The same city where Zelemir discovered the history of his dark powers.
I hope that these same records may hold the key to understanding why he seeks you... and how we can turn it against him.
This city is here...in the Pit?
Yes, a relic of times before the war.
What about Zelemir? Won't he know its secrets if he's been there before?
Yes, there is a risk that he may anticipate our movements.
But we cannot stay here. If we move fast and lightly enough, we may shut ourselves into the city before he can rebuild his forces.
Our secret entrance lies here on the desert floor.
The enemy is on our heels!
Quick, we have to get into the city!
No! If we flee now, the gate will be in enemy hands.
His whole force will follow, and we will be trapped in the maze of winding streets with no escape.
We must defeat them here and destroy the entrance behind us.
*I cannot tell how long I was in that place below the earth-$Nweeks, months perhaps, without the sun,$Nliving each moment in fear of the writhing blackness,$Nand the things that moved within it.
*$N$N$N$N$N-from the collected tales of Klest Kada, Nomad adventurer
*Flee while you still can, you miserable wretches! You gibbering misbegotten scraplings! You...you...effeminate baboons!
You think that last one was too much? I'm trying to keep things fresh, you know. Trying out some new insults.
Are you quite done? I must seal the entrance behind us.
Wow... you can make things explode with your mind?
Forgive me! Please don't blow my head off with your mind-splodey powers!
I'll give back the shoes I stole from your pack, I swear! I'll pay you back a hundred shoes, a thousand shoes!
Calm yourself. The crystals that grow here are naturally unstable. The Quaid Empire built this city to harvest these mineral deposits for the war.
I rigged a simple fuse to trigger the explosion.
Wait, what? Oh, never mind then.
Years ago Zelemir and I walked these same halls, still caked with the gore of battle.
Was this where Zelemir found the source of his power?
No, we found a cryptic history, written in Quaid so ancient even an accomplished scholar like Zelemir could scarcely make it out.
So if this ancient power is elsewhere, what are we doing here?
Zelemir fears you, likely because of something he read in that script – something he did not share at the time...
But empty regret is of no use.  I must now correct the monster I had a hand in creating.
I must find that secret record, and discover what Zelemir fears so greatly.
So you think you can read it this time?
I have had years...besides, this time - we have a Quaid princess with us.
And she'll help us?  With your past history –
But, I thought you sealed the entrance!
I did! This must be something else!
It was once a key ingredient in Quaid siege weapons.
The mines below the city are riddled with it.
Do you think that's where these Revenant came from?
No, they were wearing Ash uniforms... or what was left of them.
These men were knights of the Ash Kingdom.
We sealed the entrance behind us! How would they have gotten here?
But we cannot turn back now.
Our goal lies in the Royal Records room.
The physical nature is driven by the spirit.
And the spirit... can be seen with the right eyes...called out...
...I'm just saying, if I were planning a city, I'd probably pick a different place.
You know, somewhere that doesn't have a million tons of explosives sitting underneath it.
You got here just in the nick of time.
I am in your debt, lady.
It means little in this world of chaos, but I stand by the traditions of my family.
A life for a life.  I am in your service until such time as this debt has been paid.
The Royal House of Ash demands no less.
The Royal House?  You are a -
A minor royal, to be sure, but the blood in my veins still demands that I uphold the family honor.
It is we who are honored, Prince.
Do not bow to me, lady.  It is I who must serve.
My blade is yours to command, in whatever endeavor you undertake.
None of this “stand on one foot and sing The Tipsy Tiger song backwards!  In falsetto!”
You would be amazed at the crazy ideas people get when they hear “life debt”.
I did not expect to find any still living in the Citadel.
The residents of the Pit have little sympathy for a guard who finds himself infected.
On a side note: mob beatings are totally not all they're cracked up to be.
Anyway, some of the older veterans remembered the Citadel's secret entrance – a place where we were free from reprisals.
But even here we are not safe from the plague.
They were once members of this camp.  Every one of us that dies of this infernal plague bolsters their numbers.
Then it is not safe for us to stay long.
You intend to press further into the city?
It is imperative that we reach the Royal Records Room.
The information there could turn the tide of this disaster.
I should warn you, there are more dangers in this city than just the Revenant.
Creatures of fire sleep here in the dark places of the earth.
We will face whatever dangers we have to.
I've always wanted to be able to say that!
Hey badguys! Any of you out there?
No? Good! Ok, we're done. Let's go eat!
Yeah, that's not how standing on guard duty works.
Oh, right! I forgot the most important step:
How is that going to help anything?
We've got to present an intimidating front. I mean, a weenie like you standing out here would practically encourage people to attack us.
It's an entirely new muscle group I discovered. I call them the Slaktoids.
No, you idiot! That over there. Someone's following us.
They must be drawn to the irresistible allure of my rugged manliness.
Or they're an enemy spy. Stay here, I'm going to check it out.
What? You can't kill things without me! Wait up!
...I must have accidentally pulled you with me. But that would mean...
Wonderful. Any other morons you want to bring here while you're at it?
How about the gajillion Revenant outside?
How did I end up here? No no no! It's too early!
We're going to have to fade again.
Ok, that's the last of them. Now I think we deserve some answers.
Just who are you, and what are you trying to do? How can you travel to the-
*Ok, I expect this kind of idiocy from $BER, but you, $KNI? Really?
At least now there's something in there that isn't burnt.
Hey! Just because I don't wolf things down raw-
*$MCG, you may be good at a lot of things, but you need to admit that I'm better at all of them.
Better at getting smacked in the face with a ladle!
DOES NO ONE CARE THAT I'M STANDING IN A POT OF SOUP?!!!
Well, when you put it like that...
Yeah, what are you doing there?
Do I need to demonstrate the strength of my ladle hand?
*Oh, $KNI and I were kidnapped by this sorceress who was following us for probably sinister reasons but before we could interrogate her she escaped.
What? Why didn't you tell me?
*Obviously $KNI was too busy standing in soup to address the important matters at hand.
Could I see that ladle for a moment?
So she drew you into the halfway world just like I can?
More than that. She could vanish and reappear in a new location.
If I could do that I sure as hell wouldn't be hanging out in the Pit.
I think she's looking for something. When we appeared in the strange ruins she said something about it “not being time yet”.
She was trying to carve some sort of symbol into the palm of her hand.
No idea what for, but I wasn't going to wait around to see.
It's a little like Nomad weapons I've seen before, but the craftsmanship is better than anything coming from the tribes these days.
...I've seen sketches in the library of things like this...this is ancient...
Whoever she is, she posses a frightening amount of knowledge.
We should be on our guard from now on.
Hey, new guy!  Let me fill you in on some basic rules around here.
The role of ruggedly handsome melee fighter has been filled.
So why don't you just go find yourself some sissy projectiles to throw, ok new guy?
We wouldn't want you getting hurt on the front lines.  You might break a nail or something.
*My name is $KNI, and I don't appreciate your tone.
Oh, tough guy?  Tough guy hiding behind your manly armor?
...Of little girls that are scared of getting hit!
That doesn't even make sense.  Who goes into battle wanting to get hit?
Even you wear pants in battle.
They must have come into the city from somewhere else.
Then the secret entrance has been discovered.
*$KNI is amazed to see the Revenant fall.
As were we all when you first slew them.
How can I kill these things when no one else can?
The Revenant, as we call them, are really just empty vessels for Zelemir's will.
Through arcane powers I still cannot comprehend, his spirit drives their dead flesh.
Just as I cannot cut your will with a sword, it is impossible to destroy Zelemir's control over them.
But you are not in this world when you do so.  You stand on the brink of death, halfway into the world of spirit.
There your will can sever Zelemir's.
Then, that which was already dead becomes so once more...
What mortal dares enter the presence of a god?
Speak, or I shall end you with fire!
This is not the time to fight!  Revenant approach!
Those vermin again? They shall face divine fury!
But you have not been absolved of your impudence in coming here.
However, I may be moved to pardon this affront, should you perform a certain task for me.
I will refrain from roasting you alive.
That sounds like a pretty good deal to me.
We will require something more in return.
Lead us to the Royal Records Room, and we will aid you in whatever you ask.
...It is a poor time indeed when mortals barter with the gods.
You are fortunate – I am in a good mood.  I will agree to this arrangement.  You have my word.
Now follow me.  You have work to do.
Wow, next time you want to tick off a giant fire breathing monster, let me get out of the area first.
If she had wanted to kill us, we would already be dead.  She needs us for something.
...If we can use that to our advantage, all the better.
I'm going to avoid standing next to you while she's here.
I thought you would be thrilled...being all um...fiery and everything.
Do you hear how she calls herself a god?
This is not one of the flame-servers.
I fear we traffic with one of the dark ones...using the secret of fire for their own selfish glory.
But, even the wicked can be used to good ends.
*Well said, $MCG, but it is still very dangerous.  Many have thought that they were wise enough to fool the powers of darkness.
Do not let hubris lead you to deception.
In the beginning, all dragons served the Flame...
...and the Flame sent them into the world to serve as shining examples to men.
But some dragons, when they saw the works of man, the shining gold and the bright jewels, coveted them.
They thought no longer of serving the Cosmic Flame, but instead abused their powers for their own aggrandizement.
Looting and hoarding, they became pathetic and ruined creatures, a mockery of their true purpose.
Others spent so long in the world that they forgot Who had sent them and why.
They wandered the earth, not fallen, but with only a shadowy recollection of their true calling.
Finally, the fewest and wisest of them stayed true to the Great Fire.
These are the only ones you wish to meet.
The ones who have forgotten are dangerous and unpredictable, but sometimes give blessings and fortune.
The fallen lead only to destruction.
Which do you think our companion is?
She has either fallen or forgotten.  For our sakes I hope -
Now you shall serve your task.
I fend off hundreds, but they keep coming.
Each morning more of my children are missing.
Why would the Revenant want dragons?
Now is not the time for questions, mortal.
Now is the time for fire.
*Dance for us, blood of the slain!$NSing for the glory of the master!$NSpill, spurt, wash the world till he comes again!
*$N$N$N$N$N-Song of the Blood-mad, as recounted by Geka Tribe survivors
Your children are safe, mighty one.
We have upheld our end of the bargain.
But my children are too famished to travel to the room you seek.
It has been many months since last we fed...
Is there any way we can help?
You are bold, for a mortal.
Perhaps one or two of your companions are expendable?
The oaf with the strange eyes for instance.
Or the angry silent girl, filled with distrustful glances.
I suppose it may be sufficient.
But hurry! My patience wears thin.
Sheep?  Really?  That's the best you could come up with?
Look, I'm just trying to keep people from getting eaten, ok?
What do you think is going to happen when we fail to find these magical sheep you promised?
I just said what popped into my head.
And the first thing that popped into your head was “sheep?”  Does this look like a pasture to you?
No, the first thing that popped into my head was “Yeah, take the annoying skinny girl with the black hair that doesn't ever shut up.”
What doesn't shut up, me or my hair?
You know, I don't even need to come up with a witty retort, because that statement is just so innately stu-
Not many people know about the secret sheep stores beneath Quaid cities.
They're usually just for when the city is besieged, but in this case I think we can make an exception.
I just hope they haven't gone...feral.
With the city abandoned for so long they'll have had little to eat but cave fungus and each other.
Someday, I would really like to meet a horde of something that doesn't try to kill me.
From the looks of it, today is not that day.
My children feast and grow strong.
*We have upheld our end of the bargain, $DRA.
Very well, I will take you to this Royal Records Room, but I have a final stipulation.
When you are done, you must take us with you out of this Pit.
You have wings, can't you just fly out?
You ask too many questions, mortal.
Even one as useful as you may be burned for offense.
Fine, we would be happy to have you with us.
But all of you must fight like everyone else.
You drive a hard bargain, mortal.
As long as my children are compensated for their labors, we shall bring fire to your enemies.
Over the years we have collected many mortal arms and armors in our hoard.
We have no use for them, but they are quite shiny, and we like shiny things.
I'm sure a warband like your own could put them to great use.
For the right price of course...
Man, that sheep stew is FANTASTIC!
